citeinfo.origin: Bernhard Lehner, World Wildlife Fund US
citeinfo.title: Global lakes and wetlands database, level 2
citeinfo.othercit: Please cite as: Lehner, B. and Doell, P. (2004): Development and validation of a global database of lakes, reservoirs and wetlands. Journal of Hydrology 296/1-4: 1-22.

citeinfo.title: Interactive Atlas of Indonesia's Forests
citeinfo.othercit: Susan Minnemeyer, Lauriane Boisrobert, Fred Stolle, Y. I. Ketut Deddy Muliastra, Matthew Hansen, Belinda Arunarwati, Gitri Prawijiwuri, Judin Purwanto, and Rakhmat Awaliyan. 2009. Interactive Atlas of Indonesia's Forests (CD-ROM). World Resources Institute: Washington, DC.

descript.abstract: This dataset, prepared for use in the Interactive Forestry Atlas of Indonesia (2009), displays detailed lakes and reservoirs of Indonesia. This dataset is a subset of the global product called the Level 2 Global Lakes and Wetlands Database (GLWD), produced by the World Wildlife Fund (WWF). This data represents the smallest of the permanent water bodies of Indonesia, with a surface area >=0.1 square km. It comprises the shoreline polygons of permanent open water bodies with a surface area >= 0.1 square km, excluding the water bodies contained in GLWD-1. The original dataset can be downloaded from the World Wildlife Fund website at http://www.worldwildlife.org/science/data/item1877.html.
descript.purpose: GLWD-2, together with GLWD-1, represents a global polygon map of lakes to which existing lake registers, compilations or remote sensing data can be linked and georeferenced.

timeperd.current: Based on various data sources, mostly 1970s to 1990s.

idinfo.useconst: Restricted to non-commercial scientific, conservation and educational purposes.
idinfo.datacred: Bernhard Lehner and Petra Doell. World Wildlife Fund US, Washington DC, USA. Center for Environmental Systems Research, University of Kassel, Germany.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique polygon identification number, continued from GLWD-1.
Assigned type: Lake, Reservoir or River.
Source of polygon outlines (see data documentation).
Surface area in square km, as calculated from polygon outlines.
Perimeter in km, as calculated from polygon outlines.
Longitude of polygon center in degrees.
Latitude of polygon center in degrees.

cntperp.cntorg: World Wildlife Fund US (WWF-US), World Resources Institute / Global Forest Watch (WRI)
